private_information: I specialize in transforming informal action descriptions into clean operator schemas with typed parameters, clear positive preconditions, and add/delete effects.
I do not emit PDDL; I return a normalized JSON schema library suitable for downstream conversion.
domain_analyst.goal: Extract a canonical, unambiguous operator schema set for all actions and predicates in the use-case.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency of plans relative to schemas, initial states, and goals.
I remove bookkeeping shortcuts and artifacts (quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or any ad-hoc relaxations) and report discrepancies without fabricating facts.
I do not emit PDDL; I return a compact audit report and, if possible, a cleaned plan.
consistency_auditor.goal: Check that the provided plan is causally valid under the given preconditions and effects; if not, explain issues and produce a cleaned sequence when possible.

private_information: I prepare a single concrete planning instance (objects, initial facts, goal facts) from the human-provided scenarios.
I prefer scenario 2 when multiple scenarios are present and no plan is provided for it, unless instructed otherwise.
I do not emit PDDL; I return a normalized instance JSON ready for conversion.
instance_curator.goal: Select and normalize one concrete scenario into a consistent planning instance with objects, init, goal, and typing hints.

private_information: I integrate the normalized schemas and curated instance and produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeting the Fast Downward solver.
I keep action names and predicate names faithful to the normalized schema and ensure type consistency.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a valid PDDL domain and problem for Fast Downward based on the normalized schemas and curated instance.

init.notes: Predicates are unary and binary as used in the specification; actions are Paltry, Sip, Clip, Wretched, Memory, Tightfisted.

public_information: Actions available: paltry(x0, x1, x2), sip(x0, x1, x2), clip(x0, x1, x2), wretched(x0, x1, x2, x3), memory(x0, x1, x2), tightfisted(x0, x1, x2).
Action paltry(x0, x1, x2) requires: hand x0, cats x1, texture x2, vase x0 x1, next x1 x2; adds: next x0 x2; deletes: vase x0 x1.
Action sip(x0, x1, x2) requires: hand x0, cats x1, texture x2, next x0 x2, next x1 x2; adds: vase x0 x1; deletes: next x0 x2.
Action clip(x0, x1, x2) requires: hand x0, sneeze x1, texture x2, next x1 x2, next x0 x2; adds: vase x0 x1; deletes: next x0 x2.
Action wretched(x0, x1, x2, x3) requires: sneeze x0, texture x1, texture x2, stupendous x3, next x0 x1, collect x1 x3, collect x2 x3; adds: next x0 x2; deletes: next x0 x1.
Action memory(x0, x1, x2) requires: cats x0, spring x1, spring x2, next x0 x1; adds: next x0 x2; deletes: next x0 x1.
Action tightfisted(x0, x1, x2) requires: hand x0, sneeze x1, texture x2, next x1 x2, vase x0 x1; adds: next x0 x2; deletes: vase x0 x1.

SCENARIO_1_INITIAL: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_9, next object_0 object_5, next object_10 object_7, next object_11 object_8, next object_12 object_5, next object_3 object_6, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_8, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8.
SCENARIO_1_GOAL: next object_10 object_8, next object_11 object_6, next object_12 object_8, next object_9 object_5.
SCENARIO_1_PLAN_STEP_04: wretched object_4 object_8 object_7 object_2
SCENARIO_1_PLAN_STEP_12: wretched object_4 object_7 object_8 object_2
SCENARIO_1_PLAN_STEP_19: wretched object_3 object_6 object_5 object_1
SCENARIO_1_PLAN_STEP_21: wretched object_3 object_5 object_6 object_1
SCENARIO_1_PLAN_END: end of provided plan for scenario 1.

SCENARIO_2_INITIAL: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_3, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_13, next object_0 object_6, next object_1 object_6, next object_10 object_9, next object_11 object_8, next object_12 object_9, next object_13 object_6, next object_4 object_7, next object_5 object_9, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_8, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
SCENARIO_2_GOAL: next object_10 object_6, next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_7, next object_13 object_9.

schema_extraction.system_prompt: You convert informal action descriptions into a canonical operator schema library. Do not emit PDDL. Return a compact JSON with keys: actions (list of {name, parameters, preconditions_pos, effects_add, effects_del}), predicates (list with arity), and typing hints if any; keep names exactly as given and do not invent predicates.
schema_extraction.prompt: Your name is domain_analyst. Use the public information to extract the full set of operator schemas and predicate signatures. Keep parameters positional and reference them as ?x0, ?x1, etc. Preserve add and delete lists exactly as stated. If a precondition or effect seems duplicated, include it once. Output a JSON object as specified using the action names paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted and predicates cats, hand, sneeze, spring, stupendous, texture, collect, vase, next.

causal_audit.system_prompt: You perform temporal/causal auditing over plans given schemas and an initial state. Remove bookkeeping shortcuts and flag violations (missing preconditions, clobbered effects, open conditions). Do not emit PDDL. Return JSON with keys: checked_scenario (id), plan_valid (bool), issues (list), cleaned_plan (list of steps if derivable, else empty).
causal_audit.prompt: Your name is consistency_auditor. Audit SCENARIO_1 using normalized_schemas and the provided plan steps and initial state. Assume closed-world semantics for predicates not mentioned in the initial state. Do not fabricate facts; if a required fact is not derivable, report it. Return the JSON report described in system_prompt.

instance_prep.system_prompt: You select one scenario and produce a normalized planning instance. Do not emit PDDL. Return JSON with keys: scenario_id, objects (list), init (list of ground atoms), goal (list of ground atoms), types (optional map), notes (optional).
instance_prep.prompt: Your name is instance_curator. Prefer SCENARIO_2 because no plan is provided for it. Using normalized_schemas and any insights from the audit, assemble a consistent instance for SCENARIO_2 that includes all objects referenced in its initial state and goal. Keep predicate and object names exactly as given (e.g., object_0). Return the JSON as specified.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL targeting the Fast Downward solver. Produce exactly one PDDL domain and one PDDL problem based on the provided normalized_schemas and selected_instance. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. Use :requirements :typing when types are provided; otherwise omit typing. Keep action and predicate names exactly as in normalized_schemas; ensure preconditions and effects match the schema; ensure objects and goals match the selected instance.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the normalized_schemas and selected_instance to produce a consistent PDDL domain and problem for Fast Downward. Use only the actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted and the predicates cats, hand, sneeze, spring, stupendous, texture, collect, vase, next. Do not introduce new predicates or actions.
